title: Quarto Live Demo!
text:
Quarto RevealJS Slides
This is a Quarto template for creating RevealJS slides.
The template can be used as a starting point for your own slides and includes a number of different layouts and examples of Markdown syntax, slide layout, links, embedding images and configuration options.

title: Quarto Live Demo!
text:
Formatting
Quarto slides are written in Markdown.



Markdown Syntax
Output




*italics*, **bold**, ***bolditalics***
italics, bold, bold italics


superscript^1^, subscript~2~
superscript1, subscript2


~~strikethrough~~
strikethrough


code
code


[Quarto](https://quarto.org)
Quarto




Speaker Notes can be added to each slide. Formatting can be used here too.

title: Quarto Live Demo!
text:
Columns and Lists
Slides can have columns and you can create lists of different types.


ToDo (code)
+ Learn Markdown
+ Create Quarto Slides
+ Publish on GitHub

ToDo (Rendered)

Learn Markdown
Create Quarto Slides
Publish on GitHub




Slides can have columns and we can create unordered lists.

title: Quarto Live Demo!
text:
Columns and Lists (cont.)


Ordered (code)
1. A comes before
2. B which is followed by
3. C before D

Ordered (Rendered)

A comes before
B which is followed by
C




Or ordered lists.

title: Quarto Live Demo!
text:
Tables
You can manually add tables.


| Right | Left | Default | Center |
|------:|:-----|---------|:------:|
|   12  |  12  |    12   |    12  |
|  123  |  123 |   123   |   123  |
|    1  |    1 |     1   |     1  |




Right
Left
Default
Center




12
12
12
12


123
123
123
123


1
1
1
1






Tables can be added, but there is a better way to include these programatically

title: Quarto Live Demo!
text:
Equations



Markdown Syntax
Output




inline math $E = mc^{2}$
inline math \(E = mc^{2}\)


display math: $$E = mc^{2}$$
display math: \[E = mc^{2}\]




You can write equations if you need to.

title: Quarto Live Demo!
text:
Embed Images
Figures can be embeded using a URL and resized.



SheffieldR Hex

title: Quarto Live Demo!
text:
Embed Images (cont.)
You can also include images locally.1 and make them hyperlinks.
![[OSC Sheffield](https://osc-international.com/osc-sheffield)](img/OSC_Sheffield.png){width=300}



OSC Sheffield





Make sure to git add them otherwise they wonâ€™t publish

title: Quarto Live Demo!
text:
R code


Include R code and output with automatic referencing (see FigureÂ 1)

library(ggplot2)

ggplot(airquality, aes(Temp, Ozone)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "loess")







FigureÂ 1: Temperature and ozone level.







R code can be embeded and executed to produce tables and figures.

title: Quarto Live Demo!
text:
Python code

Include Python code and output too
#| label: fig-polar
#| fig-cap: "A line plot on a polar axis."
#| warning: false
#| eval: false
#| echo: true
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'}
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()


#| label: fig-polar2
#| fig-cap: "A line plot on a polar axis."
#| warning: false
#| eval: true
#| echo: true
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'}
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()

::::

You can include Python code too

title: Quarto Live Demo!
text:
General code
There are lots of options for showing, hiding, highlighting code blocks.
#| eval: true
#| echo: true
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(subplot_kw={'projection': 'polar'})
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()
